result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam R. Kopp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Intentionally Point Firearm At Person, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: DNA Proof of Submission form
Detailed bill from MCHS Oakridge

Restitution Hearing:  Defendant appeared in custody in person with counsel Nicholas Layland.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  DA states a claim has been filed with the Victim's Compensation Fund but haven't heard anything back yet.  Judge and defense both had question about page 3 of hospital bill showing $0.00 balance.  DA Fox called Mayo Account Services to verify the balance due which is $65.01.25 plus pharmacy bills of $71.00 and $34.80 for a total of $6157.05.  Attorney Layland has one other question regarding the bill which is cleared up and the defense has no other issues.  Court orders the restitution is made part of the judgment as requested.  DA Fox notifies the Court that if they hear back from Crime Victim Compensation Fund that they will cover he will notify the Court.  Judge asks about letter submitted by defendant's father regarding return of weapons owned by him.  Copy of letter given to both counsel.  DA Fox will take care of return of propery.
Def. father stopped in to check the status of his request for firearm return.
Restitution hearing at 04-14-2015 04:00 pm
from defendant's father.  Would like his rifle returned.  CC to ADA & Attorney Layland
Restitution hearing at 03-20-2015 01:30 pm
destroyed FIDR
Restitution hearing at 03-24-2015 04:00 pm

ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared with Attorney Layland.  Discussion held on the amount of restitution owing.  Defense and defendant wish to talk regarding plea further off the record.  Defense requests a restitution hearing.  Court questions defendant on whether he wishes to proceed today.  Defendant wishes to plead.    Defendant plead guilty to counts 1, 3 and 7.  Other counts dismissed and read in.  Court reviews plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  He understands. Attorney Layland stipulates to a factual basis.  Court finds defendant's plea and waiver of constitutional rights is made freely, voluntarily and intelligently.  Factual basis found.  Find guilty of counts 1, 3 and 7.  Joint recommendation for 2 years probation.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Domestic violence counseling and domestic violence court.  No contact with the victim.  Not possess any firearms.  Obtain and maintain employment. Defendant elects to not exercise his right to allocution.  Court questions lack of jail time in the joint recommendation.  Court orders sentence withheld, 2 years probation.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Domestic violence counseling agent recommends and domestic violence court, if agent recommends.  No contact with the victim.  Not possess any firearms.  Obtain and maintain employment.  Restitution to be determined at a restitution hearing. CC.  45 days jail on count 3, to start on or before March 15, 2015 at 6 pm.   If revoked he is entitled to 7 days credit.  Any violations of conditions of probation, jail to commence immediately.
Restitution worksheet and attachments (attachments scanned seperately as confidential)

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on January 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on February 2, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant appeared with counsel Nicholas Layland.  Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Wavied reading of complaint, stood mute, and waived time limits for preliminary hearing.  Judge does colloquy regarding waiving time limits.  Accept waiver of time limits.  Set for pretrial and status dates.  Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance on December 22, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant appeared without cuonsel.  Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant is to complete process at SPD or may someone on his own.  Given return date and must have attorney present at that hearing.  Bond continued.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals: with either Jamie S. or Sharon S. nor their residence or place of work. Not to possess any firearms.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.
DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in custody with attorney.
